title: Anti-TB drugs can increase risk of TB re-infection

title_detail.value: Anti-TB drugs can increase risk of TB re-infection

summary: Current treatments for tuberculosis (TB) are very effective in controlling TB infection caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis (Mtb). They don't, however, always prevent reinfection. Why this happens is one of the long-standing questions in TB research. A team of scientists may have found the answer... in the gut.
